Content: The regulation follows the NAIC's model regulation: agents must act in the consumer’s best interest.
The state has enacted a best interest standard for agents who recommend an annuity to their customers.
The state has amended its Suitability in Annuity Transactions Rule to adopt the NAIC’s model standard.
The state amended its Suitability in Annuity Transactions Regulation to adopt the NAIC’s model standard.
Brokers, investment advisors and other financial professionals must put consumers’ interests first when recommending annuities.

The state rejected a bill imposing a fiduciary standard on brokers and insurance representatives “to act in the best interest of the customer.
Broker-dealers and broker-dealer agents must put a customer’s interests first with investment advice and recommendations.
The state has amended Chapter 41A of its insurance code to adopt the NAIC’s model suitability standard.
The state has amended the Nebraska Protection in Annuity Transactions Act to adopt the NAIC’s model suitability standard.
In April 2019, a fiduciary rule was proposed to apply to all investment professionals registered in the state.

Financial service providers must consider clients’ interests first when recommending annuities. Broker-dealers must meet new disclosure and training requirements. Annuity sellers can’t call themselves advisors unless licensed as such.
